Pre-Game Insights: Josh Naylor returns to action for the Cleveland Guardians when they face Tyler Holton and the Detroit Tigers on Saturday at 1:08 PM ET on TBS.
Naylor is hitting .243 with 27 doubles, 31 home runs and 58 walks. Among hitters in MLB play, Naylor ranks 18th in homers and eighth in RBI.
Naylor is 1-for-7 in his career against Tyler Holton.
When facing off against Tyler Holton this season, Naylor is 0-for-5.
Against Tyler Holton last year, Naylor went 1-for-1.
Naylor has reached base with a hit 92 times this season in 152 games played (60.5%), including multiple hits in 25.7% of them (39 times).
In 28 of 152 games this season, he has homered (18.4%). He’s left the yard in 4.9% of his trips to the plate in 2024.
Naylor has scored at least one run 67 times this season in 152 tries (44.1%), including scoring multiple runs in 9.9% of games (15 times).

He has picked up at least one RBI in 40.1% of his games this season (61 of 152), with two or more RBI in 30 of those games (19.7%). He has also driven in three or more of his team’s runs in 12 contests.
Naylor has been set down on strikes in 55.3% of his 152 games this year, with two or more punchouts in 12.5% of those contests (19).
Tigers starter Tyler Holton holds a record of 7-2 with a 2.19 ERA and 77 Ks in 94 1/3 innings pitched.
Holton has registered an ERA of 2.19, with 7.3 strikeouts per nine innings, in 66 games this season. Opponents are batting .173 against him.
